issue.title: [CF 1145] archaeology fragments conditions - tweaks needed
issue.body:
(note: using latest current alpha, 7.3.5-5-gc0457b4 )

three archaeology-related issues/changes needed:

1)
Can you please add a condition that checks if any archaeology projects has enough fragments for solving an artifact?

2)
I cannot set conditions for tracking some archaeology fragment types if the currently-connected alt has never collected that particular type of fragment.

This might be OK for a character-bound icon but it's NOT OK when setting up an icon in a global group that will be used by all alts.
Please allow creation of conditions checking for all archaeology fragment types when setting up a global icon (or just allow creation of conditions for all archeology fragment types for all cases, without limiting them by discovered archaeology types.)

and
3)
would it be possible to also add a general archaeology condition that checks if any fragment type has accumulated over a defined limit? As it is now, i would have to set individual conditions checks for each fragment type, 15 conditional checks (one for each archaeology type), each of them checking for 180 fragments in their respective area.

It would be more efficient to just have a single condition that check for all types instead of 15 individual ones.
(and yes, i know i could set up a meta icon, but i already have created so many icons that TMW has started to throw LUA errors sometimes when i start combat... having yet another icon group is not something i look forward to)

comments.body:
1) No, sorry. The archaeology conditions were only ever added because they work exactly the same as the regular currency conditions - no extra code needed to be written to include them. In hindsight, they probably never should have been added, since TMW's area of focus is combat, and archaeology is combat not.

2) The conditions still function - you just can't select them. So, just set it up the first time you see that fragment type on any of your characters (which might happen 2-3 times per expansion), and you will be set for life.

3) No. It wouldn't be any more efficient - if anything, it would be less efficient. TMW conditions already compile down to pure Lua, which means that they benefit from all the things that the language provides, like short-circuit evaluation. A single condition might actually be slightly less efficient in terms of CPU usage than many conditions.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
